Class DigitalDoily

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • DigitalDoily
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public class DigitalDoily
extends javax.swing.JFrame
    This class starts the application. First, it creates the GUI, then adds the logic behind it. In the application you can: - Draw digital doilies - Undo or clear progress ( it is possible to undo a clear) - Change the size of the line you are currently drawing and number of sectors - Select if you want to see the lines or reflect the points - Change the colour of the line you are drawing in and the background colour - Save as and save progress ( The data is saved in a file called saves_aas1u16.txt) - Load past images - Delete images from file (This will not delete the images on the disk)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        Adds the buttons and panels to the picture panel at the button of the window.
        Parameters:
        deleteButtonPanel - Current delete button

      • addStuffToControlPanel

        public void addStuffToControlPanel()
        Adds all the buttons and functionality behind them to the controlPanel. For this, we use a grid layout to devide the panel in 5 zones. The, for each one we assign JPanel that will contain 2 elements. After most changes we call the repaint or repaintAndRecreate method.

      • addPicturesFromFile

        public void addPicturesFromFile(java.lang.String filePath)
        Adds the pictures from file to the picturePanel. But will not load the data from it to memory. It does this by just reading the filePath lines in the file, then painting them and creating objects containing their index.
        Parameters:
        filePath - File from which the data is read and saved in the current panels

      • addNewPicturePanel

        public void addNewPicturePanel(java.lang.String path)
        Adds one picture from the path to the current arrayList of images. Additionally, we add Listeners to the images responsible for
        Parameters:
        path - Path to the picture.

      • loadThisInDrawingPanel

        public void loadThisInDrawingPanel(int position)
        Load the selected image in the drawing panel.
        Parameters:
        position - The index ( order number of the double clicked image)

      • addPictures

        public void addPictures(int n)
        Adds the picture from the save file to the drawing panel from the n position.
        Parameters:
        n - Position of loaded image in the save file

      • savePannelInFile

        public void savePannelInFile()
        Saves the current panel at the end of the save file. This will not override any other saves, but will share the path with previous one if there are any. We first get all the data from the current drawing panel and then write them based on the categories: -file location -singular values -colours -sizes -windowSizes -points -starts

      • deleteImage

        public void deleteImage(int image)
        Deletes the image at position imagefrom the saves file, not from disk. We do this by reading from the file and writing the remaining info in a temporary file. Then, deletes the temporary file.
        Parameters:
        image - Order number of image.

      • changeSizeBasedOnSizeBox

        public int changeSizeBasedOnSizeBox(javax.swing.JTextField sectorsTextField)
        Returns the number in the size sectorsTextField x. If we encounter an error we set the size to the default one.
        Parameters:
        sectorsTextField - Address of textField
        Returns:
        The number in the textBox or the default size
